alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 17 at 4:16PM MST until July 17 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR GILA AND COCONINO COUNTIES... At 415 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain had ended across the warned area. However, flooding remains a concern due to earlier rainfall. Between 1.5 and 2.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Haigler Creek, Haigler Canyon Campground, Rim Campground, Crook Campground, Alderwood Campground, Sinkhole Campground and Forest Road 171 Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 277 and 285. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Marsh Creek, Haigler Creek, Canyon Creek, Hunter Creek, Chevelon Canyon, Pine Creek, Cherry Creek and Sharp Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
